  • Constraints for implementers: PIN must be hashed; track failed attempts

docs.title: Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Provide an in-POS payment terminal UI with quick tender entry, multiple payment types, multi-currency cash, gratuity, coupon/discount, printing, and a drawer “NO SALE” function.
  • Evidence: PaymentView builds keypad + quick amounts and routes to SettleTicketProcessor.doSettle(...) by PaymentType.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Panel / view (embedded in SettleTicketDialog and retail mode OrderView)
  • Controls observed:
  • Due amount display + tendered amount input
  • Keypad digits + dot + clear
  • Quick add buttons: 1,2,5,10,20,50,100, Exact Amount, Next Amount, NO SALE
  • Tender actions: Cash, Multi Currency Cash (optional), Credit Card, Debit Card, Gift, Other (custom)
  • Gratuity, Coupon/Discount, Print Ticket
  • Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Ticket empty guard for cash: doPayByCash() errors if ticket null or no items.
  • Multi-currency gating: Multi-currency cash button is only visible when TerminalConfig.isEnabledMultiCurrency().

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
• UpdateView: sets due and tendered to the current due amount.
  • Numeric keypad: appends digits/dot into txtTenderedAmount with some clearing behavior (clearPreviousAmount).
  • Quick buttons:
  • Exact Amount: sets tendered = due.
  • Next Amount: rounds due up to next integer (Math.ceil(dd)) formatted as ##.00.
  • NO SALE: DrawerUtil.kickDrawer().
  • Other amount buttons: add their amount to existing tendered.
  • Tender actions:
  • Cash: parses tendered and calls ticketProcessor.doSettle(PaymentType.CASH, amount).
  • Credit/debit/gift/other: call ticketProcessor.doSettle(<type>, getTenderedAmount()) with stale-state reload behavior for some.
  • Multi-currency cash: opens MultiCurrencyTenderDialog, may persist CashDrawer via TerminalDAO.performBatchSave(cashDrawer), then settles cash.
  • Gratuity: delegates to ticketProcessor.doSetGratuity().
  • Coupon/discount: delegates to ticketProcessor.doApplyCoupon().
  • Print: prints ticket; if order type allows tips later and gratuity <= 0 prints with “add tips later” flag.

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Stale state: Credit/debit/cash show reload dialog via POSMessageDialog.showMessageDialogWithReloadButton.
  • Parse errors: Some paths catch generic exception and log; exact user-visible error handling varies by button.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates:
  • Payment settlement creates transactions and sets ticket paid/closed downstream (in SettleTicketProcessor and related processors).
  • Multi-currency can persist cash drawer balances.
  • Financial risk: “NO SALE” drawer kick is security-sensitive; incorrect gating or logging can create shrink risk.

docs.title: Code traceability (REQUIRED)
docs.text:
• Primary UI: com.floreantpos.ui.views.payment.PaymentView → /projects/Code/Redesign-POS/floreantpos/src/com/floreantpos/ui/views/payment/PaymentView.java
  • Processors: SettleTicketProcessor (not inspected fully here)
  • Dialogs: MultiCurrencyTenderDialog
  • Utilities: DrawerUtil.kickDrawer, TerminalConfig.isEnabledMultiCurrency

docs.title: Uncertainties (STOP; do not guess)
docs.text: • Authorization flows: Card authorization/capture/void flows likely live in processors and gateway plugins; not proven from PaymentView alone.

  • What differs / missing: Not yet assessed.

docs.text:

  • Drawer kick integration and audit logging requirements
  • Multi-currency tendering + drawer-balance persistence
  • UI requirements:
  • Keypad + quick amount behaviors must match (exact amount, next amount rounding, clear semantics)
  • Constraints for implementers:
  • Preserve NO SALE behavior (drawer kick) as a distinct action path.
  • Preserve Next Amount rounding semantics (ceil(due) and format).

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Users must log out to secure the terminal, switch users, or end their session. Security requirement.
  • Evidence: LogoutAction.java - clears current user; returns to login screen; may prompt for open tickets.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action
  • UI entry points: Switchboard → Logout button; key shortcut; timeout trigger
  • Exit paths: Logout complete / Cancel (if open tickets)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Current user authenticated
  • State checks: Check for user's open tickets
  • Manager override: Not required

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User clicks Logout (or timeout triggers)
  2. System checks for user's open tickets
  3. If open tickets exist:
  4. Warning dialog shown
  5. Option to transfer or close
  6. If confirmed:
  7. Current user cleared
  8. Session ended
  9. LoginView displayed
  10. Terminal ready for next user

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Open tickets: Must handle before logout
  • Auto-logout timeout: May force logout regardless
  • Pending transactions: Should complete or cancel

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: Session end logged
  • Audit events: Logout time recorded
  • Financial risk: Unattended terminal if no auto-logout

docs.title: Feature: Settle Ticket dialog (ticket list + payment)
Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Provide a dedicated settlement workspace showing ticket items and totals alongside payment controls, including special-case bar-tab settlement.
  • Evidence: SettleTicketDialog composes TicketViewerTable + totals + PaymentView, and handles bar-tab preauthorization capture/void.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog
  • UI entry points: Invoked via switchboard settlement action (SettleTicketAction → not inspected here)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Receipt consolidation: If ticket.orderType.isConsolidateItemsInReceipt() then ticket.consolidateTicketItems() happens in constructor.
  • Delivery charge visibility: In totals panel, delivery charge row is only visible when orderType.isDelivery() and !ticket.isCustomerWillPickup().

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. Constructed with a Ticket and current user.
  2. Initializes SettleTicketProcessor(currentUser, this) and registers as a PaymentListener.
  3. Builds UI:
  4. Ticket info header: ticket id, optional table numbers, optional customer name (from ticket property Ticket.CUSTOMER_NAME).
  5. Center: TicketViewerTable for the ticket.
  6. Bottom: subtotal/discount/delivery/tax/gratuity/total fields.
  7. Right: PaymentView bound to the same processor.
  8. On paymentDataChanged(): updates totals, payment view, and ticket table.
  9. On ticketDataChanged(): recalculates price, saves order (OrderController.saveOrder(ticket)), refreshes totals/payment, and refreshes OrderView if visible.
  10. Refresh flow reloads full ticket by id and re-applies ticketDataChanged().

docs.title: Bar tab settlement branch (settleBartab)
docs.text:
• If ticket has a bar-tab transaction that is not captured and not voided:
  • Prompts: “Pay using” with options “Pre-Authorized Tab” vs “Other Payment”.
  • If pre-authorized tab chosen: calls payUsingPreAuthorizedBartab(...).
  • Otherwise (or if choosing not to use preauth):
  • Prompts warning: “This will void Pre-Authorized amount in Tab” with “Void” vs “Cancel”.
  • If cancel: shows “Payment canceled”, marks canceled and disposes.
  • If void: ticketProcessor.doVoidBartab(...) then message “Pre-Authorized tab is voided”.

docs.title: Pre-authorized bar tab capture (payUsingPreAuthorizedBartab)
docs.text:
1. Prints ticket (behavior depends on gratuity amount; if none prints with add-tips-later flag).
  2. Prompts for tips amount via NumberSelectionDialog2.takeDoubleInput("Enter tips amount", 0.0); if >0 sets gratuity amount and recalculates.
  3. Sets transaction tender/tips/amount fields; calls ticketProcessor.captureBartabTransaction(...).
  4. Updates ticket paid amounts; if due becomes 0, marks ticket paid and possibly closed depending on orderType.isCloseOnPaid().
  5. Persists ticket changes in a new Hibernate session/transaction.
  6. Calls ticketProcessor.doAfterSettleTask(...).

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Tax included mode: displays a message token from Messages.getString("TicketView.35") instead of numeric tax.
  • DB transaction failure during bar-tab capture: transaction rollback and exception propagation.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates:
  • Ticket paid/closed state, closing date.
  • PosTransaction updates for bar tab capture.
  • Receipt printing.
  • Financial risk: Incorrect bar-tab capture/void sequencing can lead to double-charging or failing to void preauthorized amounts.

docs.title: Code traceability (REQUIRED)

• Primary UI: com.floreantpos.ui.views.payment.SettleTicketDialog → /projects/Code/Redesign-POS/floreantpos/src/com/floreantpos/ui/views/payment/SettleTicketDialog.java
  • Payment UI: PaymentView
  • Processor: SettleTicketProcessor
  • Prompts: POSMessageDialog, NumberSelectionDialog2

docs.title: Uncertainties (STOP; do not guess)
docs.text: • Full settle flow: The standard non-bar-tab settle workflow is primarily in SettleTicketProcessor and payment processors; this doc only proves UI composition and bar-tab special-case handling.

docs.text:

docs.text:

  • Atomic persistence for paid/closed transitions
  • Receipt printing before tips capture in preauth path
  • UI requirements:
  • Side-by-side ticket list + payment
  • Explicit two-step prompts for bar-tab decisioning
  • Constraints for implementers:
  • Preserve the exact prompt/branch semantics (use preauth vs other payment; void warning).
  • Preserve printing-before-tips prompt in the preauth path.

docs.text:

  • MagiDesk status: MISSING

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Track employee work hours for payroll, attendance reports, labor cost analysis. Staff must clock in to work and clock out when done.
  • Evidence: ClockInOutAction.java - toggles employee attendance state; creates AttendanceHistory records; affects employee availability for assignments.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action (button/menu item)
  • UI entry points: Login screen → Clock In/Out; Switchboard
  • Exit paths: Immediate action (no dialog or confirmation)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: User must be authenticated
  • State checks: Checks current clock status to determine in/out
  • Manager override: Not required; but early clock out may need approval

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User authenticated (usually at login)
  2. User clicks Clock In/Out button
  3. System checks current attendance status
  4. If not clocked in:
  5. Creates AttendanceHistory with clock-in time
  6. User now available for assignments
  7. If already clocked in:
  8. Updates AttendanceHistory with clock-out time
  9. Calculates hours worked
  10. Confirmation message shown
  11. Attendance updated for reporting

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Already clocked in/out: Shows current status
  • Missed clock out: Previous day left open (needs manager fix)
  • Clock out with open tickets: May require transfer first
  • Overtime: Flagged for payroll

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: AttendanceHistory entity with clockInTime, clockOutTime
  • Audit events: Clock events logged
  • Financial risk: Incorrect hours affect payroll; buddy punching

  • Entry action(s): ClockInOutAction → actions/ClockInOutAction.java
  • Workflow/service enforcement: AttendanceDAO; UserDAO
  • Messages/labels: Clock in/out status messages

  • Location/terminal tracking for punches

  • AttendanceHistory entity with user, clockIn, clockOut
  • ClockInCommand, ClockOutCommand
  • Attendance validation rules
  • API/DTO requirements: POST /attendance/clock-in; POST /attendance/clock-out
  • UI requirements: Clock In/Out button; status indicator
  • Constraints for implementers: Time must be server-side; cannot edit after lock period

docs.title: Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Provide a privileged, consolidated manager entry point for cash-control and oversight operations (drawer pull, cash drops/bleed, open tickets, server tips report, drawer kick).
  • Evidence: ManagerDialog buttons launch cash drop dialog, open tickets list dialog, drawer pull report dialog, tips cashout report dialog; also has a drawer kick action.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Modal dialog
  • UI entry points: Not proven in this file; likely invoked by a “Manager” action elsewhere.

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Modal behavior: Constructed as modal (super(Application.getPosWindow(), true)).
  • Glass pane: Uses a GlassPane while launching sub-dialogs.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
• Cash drops (drawer bleed):
  • Shows glass pane.
  • Opens CashDropDialog, calls initDate(), then open().
  • Hides glass pane.
  • Open tickets:
  • Shows glass pane.
  • Opens OpenTicketsListDialog.open().
  • Hides glass pane.
  • Drawer pull report:
  • Shows glass pane.
  • Opens DrawerPullReportDialog sized ~470x500, non-resizable.
  • Hides glass pane.
  • Server tips:
  • Shows glass pane.
  • Presents a criteria panel: user selection (UserDAO.findAll) + from/to date pickers.
  • Generates report via GratuityDAO.createReport(from,to,user).
  • Opens TipsCashoutReportDialog.
  • Hides glass pane.
  • Drawer kick:
  • Executes drawer-kick.bat from Application.getInstance().getLocation() if present.

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Sub-dialog exceptions show POSMessageDialog.showError(..., ERROR_MESSAGE, e).
  • Drawer kick fails are logged but do not show an error dialog in this method.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Financial impact:
  • Cash drops, drawer pull reports, and drawer kicks affect cash-control operations.
  • Risk: Missing/incorrect manager controls create reconciliation gaps and shrink risk.

  • Controls observed:

  • Delete Selected
  • Close
  • Scroll up/down
  • Table list of unsettled cash drops

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Data scope: Loads only “unsettled” cash drops for the current terminal: CashDropTransactionDAO.findUnsettled(terminal).
  • Selection: Single selection in the list.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. On open, initDate() loads unsettled cash drops for the current terminal.
  2. New Cash Drop:
  3. Opens NumberSelectionDialog2 with floating point enabled.
  4. Creates CashDropTransaction with:
    • drawerResetted=false
    • terminal=Application.getTerminal()
    • user=Application.getCurrentUser()
    • transactionTime=now
    • amount=<entered>
    • paymentType=PaymentType.CASH.toString()
  5. Persists via CashDropTransactionDAO.saveNewCashDrop(transaction, terminal).
  6. Delete Selected:
  7. Deletes selected transaction via CashDropTransactionDAO.deleteCashDrop(transaction, Application.refreshAndGetTerminal()).
  8. Scroll up/down rotates selection through list and scrolls to visible.

docs.title: Feature: Open Tickets List (manager view) + transfer server + void
Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Provide an operator/manager list of currently open tickets, with operational actions (void, transfer server) and a cashier-mode shortcut to resume a ticket.
  • Evidence: Loads open tickets via TicketDAO.findOpenTickets() or per-user in cashier mode, and provides Void/Transfer buttons when not cashier mode.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog (modal)
  • UI entry points: Via ManagerDialog.doShowOpenTickets().
  • Controls observed:
  • Scroll up/down
  • Close
  • (Not cashier mode only) Void, Transfer Server
  • Ticket list table: Ticket ID, Server, Date/Time, Total

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Cashier mode behavior:
  • Data scope becomes “open tickets for current user”: TicketDAO.findOpenTicketsForUser(Application.getCurrentUser()).
  • Row selection immediately loads the full ticket and sets it into OrderView, then disposes the dialog.
  • Non-cashier mode:
  • Void and Transfer Server buttons are present.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
• Close:
  • Disposes.
  • In cashier mode, opens CashierModeNextActionDialog with message Messages.getString("OpenTicketsListDialog.0").
  • Transfer server:
  • Requires a selected ticket; else error SELECT_TICKET.
  • Opens UserListDialog.
  • If not canceled and selected user differs from current owner, sets ticket.owner=selectedUser and TicketDAO.update(ticket).
  • Void:
  • Requires a selected ticket.
  • Loads full ticket: TicketDAO.loadFullTicket(ticket.getId()).
  • Opens VoidTicketDialog with that ticket.
  • If void dialog not canceled, removes ticket from list.

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths

docs.title: Feature: Drawer Pull Report (HTML preview + print)
Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Produce an end-of-shift / cash-control reconciliation report summarizing sales, taxes, tenders, tips, payouts, refunds, opening balance, drawer bleed, and exceptions (voids/discounts), with a print action.
  • Evidence: createReport() constructs detailed sections including gross receipts, receipt differential, tips differential, cash to deposit, multi-currency balances, void exceptions, and discount summaries.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog (modal)
  • UI entry points: Via ManagerDialog.doShowDrawerPullReport().
  • Controls observed: Print, Finish, scrollable HTML preview.

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Terminal state refresh: terminal = Application.refreshAndGetTerminal().
  • Report build: DrawerpullReportService.buildDrawerPullReport() assigns the report’s user from terminal assigned user.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. initialize() refreshes terminal and builds DrawerPullReport.
  2. Report preview is rendered into a JEditorPane as HTML.
  3. createReport() outputs sections:
  4. Header with terminal name and current date.
  5. Sales summary (net sales, sales tax, delivery charge, total revenue, charged tips, gross receipts).
  6. Tender breakdown (cash receipts, credit cards, debit cards, gift returns, gift cert change, cash back, refunds) → receipt differential.
  7. Tips breakdown (charged tips, tips paid) → tips differential.
  8. Cash section computing drawer accountable and cash to deposit using:
    • Cash receipts
    • Tips paid
    • Pay out amount/count
    • Cash back
    • Refund amount/count
    • Terminal opening balance
    • Drawer bleed amount/count
  9. If multi-currency enabled: fetches CashDrawer by terminal and lists CurrencyBalance entries.
  10. Void tickets exception table from drawerPullReport.getVoidTickets().
  11. Discount summary from report totals.
  12. Print button calls PosPrintService.printDrawerPullReport(drawerPullReport, terminal).

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Print failures:
  • PosException shows error message.
  • Other exceptions show a concatenated message DrawerPullReportDialog.122 + exception message.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Financial impact: This report is a reconciliation artifact; errors are high severity.
  • Audit impact: Includes void/discount exception sections and aggregates used for cash accountability.

  • Report builder: com.floreantpos.print.DrawerpullReportService.buildDrawerPullReport()
  • Printer: com.floreantpos.print.PosPrintService.printDrawerPullReport(...)
  • Multi-currency: TerminalConfig.isEnabledMultiCurrency(), CashDrawerDAO.findByTerminal(...)

  • UI requirements: Preview + print + finish.
  • Constraints for implementers: Preserve inclusion of multi-currency balances and void/discount exception sections.

docs.title: Feature: Void Ticket (with refund + tips refund + delete-vs-void)
Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Provide a controlled void workflow that can optionally perform a cash refund (including optional tip refund), record reason/waste disposition, update cash drawer balance, and emit audit/print artifacts.
  • Evidence: btnVoidActionPerformed branches on paid amount, prompts for refund, optionally refunds tips, decides delete vs void based on kitchen-print state, prints refund + generic report, and logs ActionHistory.VOID_CHECK.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog (modal)
  • UI entry points:
  • From switchboard via VoidTicketAction (not yet traced)
  • From open tickets list via OpenTicketsListDialog.doVoidTicket()
  • Controls observed:
  • Void reason dropdown + add-new void reason (“…”) via NotesDialog
  • Checkbox: Items wasted
  • Ticket detail view
  • Buttons: Void, Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Void reasons: Loaded from VoidReasonDAO.findAll(); failure shows CANNOT_LOAD_VOID_REASONS.
  • Refund amount prompt: Only when ticket.getPaidAmount() > 0.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. If ticket.paidAmount > 0:
  2. Computes tips amount and ticket-total-without-tips.
  3. Prompts for refund amount with default:
    • If paidAmount < ticketTotalWithoutTips: default = paidAmount.
    • Else default = paidAmount - tipsAmount.
  4. If refund amount == -1 returns (cancels).
  5. If tips > 0, asks “Do you want to refund tips?”; if YES sets ticket.gratuity.refunded=true and adds gratuity amount to refund.
  6. Validates refundAmount <= paidAmount.
  7. Creates/updates a RefundTransaction (cash, debit) and adjusts terminal current balance.
  8. Else (unpaid): if gratuity exists, sets gratuity amount to 0.
  9. Applies void metadata:
  10. ticket.voidReason from selected VoidReason.reasonText.
  11. ticket.wasted = chkItemsWasted.isSelected().
  12. ticket.voidedBy = Application.getCurrentUser().
  13. Delete-vs-void decision:
  14. If ticket.paidAmount == 0 AND !printedToKitchen() → TicketDAO.deleteTickets([ticket]).
  15. Else → TicketDAO.voidTicket(ticket).
  16. Printing:
  17. If refundTransaction exists and refundAmount > 0: ReceiptPrintService.printRefundTicket(ticket, refundTransaction).
  18. Always prints a generic report “Ticket was voided”.
  19. Audit:
  20. ActionHistoryDAO.saveHistory(currentUser, ActionHistory.VOID_CHECK, "TicketNo:<id>; Total: <total>").
  21. Closes dialog with canceled=false.

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Refund amount > paid amount: shows message and aborts.
  • Printing failure: shows error VoidTicketDialog.9 + exception message.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates:
  • Ticket void/delete state, void reason, wasted flag, voidedBy, refunded flag.
  • Refund transaction creation/update and terminal balance adjustment.
  • ActionHistory record.
  • Financial risk: Very high. Incorrect refund math or terminal balance adjustment will break reconciliation.

docs.title: Code traceability (REQUIRED)

  • DAOs: VoidReasonDAO, TicketDAO, ActionHistoryDAO
  • Printing: ReceiptPrintService.printRefundTicket, .printGenericReport

docs.text: • What TicketDAO.voidTicket does internally: Likely writes transactions and marks ticket status; must be inspected for full behavioral reconstruction.

  • Action history/audit trail
  • UI requirements: Void dialog with refund prompt, tips refund prompt, reason selection + add-new, items wasted.
  • Constraints for implementers:
  • Preserve delete-vs-void logic gate (unpaid + not printed-to-kitchen → delete).
  • Preserve refund default calculation and tips refund prompt.

docs.title: Feature: Split Ticket (2–4 splits, optional split by seat, transaction transfer)
Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Split a ticket into multiple checks (2–4) and optionally split by seat number, while preserving table occupancy and correctly re-allocating payments/overpayments.
  • Evidence: Dialog provides ⅔/4 split toggles + “Split by seat number”; persists split tickets inside a DB transaction; has logic to transfer transactions when original has paidAmount > total.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog (full-screen)
  • UI entry points: SwitchboardView.doSplitTicket() opens it.
  • Controls observed:
  • Toggle: number of splits (⅔/4)
  • Toggle: split by seat number (visible only if order type allows seat-based order)
  • Ticket views: main + up to 3 split views
  • Buttons: Finish, Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Finish guard: If main ticket view has no items, shows SplitTicketDialog.1 and aborts.
  • Seat-split visibility: btnSplitBySeat.setVisible(ticket.getOrderType().isAllowSeatBasedOrder()).

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
• Split by seat number:
  • Builds a map: seatNumber → list of ticket items.
  • Iterates seat groups, transferring items from main view to split view #2, then #3, then #4.
  • Makes view #3/#4 visible when used.
  • Changing split count:
  • Switching to 2 or 3 hides extra views and transfers all their items back to main.
  • Finish:
  • Begins Hibernate transaction (TicketDAO.createNewSession()).
  • Calls saveTicket(view, session) for each visible split view and main.
  • Collects all tickets with ids and calls ShopTableStatusDAO.addTicketsToShopTableStatus(original.tableNumbers, tickets, session).
  • Commits.
  • Logs ActionHistory.SPLIT_CHECK.

docs.title: Ticket persistence details (saveTicket)
docs.text:
• Sets split ticket’s order type to original.
  • If split has no items, returns.
  • Copies table numbers from original.
  • If split ticket id differs and original paidAmount > original totalAmount:
  • Calls transferTicketTransactionToSplitTicket then updates paid/closed state via updateModel.
  • Adds properties:
  • Ticket.SPLIT=true
  • Ticket.SPLIT_NUMBER=<viewNumber>
  • Ticket.ORIGINAL_SPLIT_TICKET_ID=<originalTicketId>
  • Persists via TicketDAO.saveOrUpdate(splitTicket, session).

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Transaction transfer tries to match a transaction whose amount equals the split due amount; otherwise clones first transaction and adjusts amounts.
  • Exceptions roll back transaction and show POS error.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates:
  • New ticket records and properties for split tracking.
  • Table occupancy updated to include multiple tickets.
  • Transactions moved/duplicated for overpayment allocation.
  • Action history logged.
  • Financial risk: Very high when reallocating payments across split tickets.

  • Views: TicketForSplitView
  • DAOs: TicketDAO, ShopTableStatusDAO, ActionHistoryDAO

  • Constraints for implementers: Preserve transaction transfer logic and persistence atomicity.

docs.title: Feature: Swipe card input dialog (with manual entry + auth-code entry options)
Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Capture card input via magnetic swipe (raw track data), with fallback paths for manual entry and external-terminal authorization code entry based on configuration.
  • Evidence: Provides Manual Entry and “Enter Authorization Code” buttons whose enabled state is driven by CardConfig.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog
  • UI entry points: Not proven here; invoked by payment processors via a CardInputListener.
  • Controls observed:
  • Password field used to capture swipe string
  • Manual Entry button (opens ManualCardEntryDialog)
  • Enter Authorization Code button (opens AuthorizationCodeDialog)
  • Submit (submits swipe)
  • Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Config gating:
  • Manual entry disabled if !CardConfig.isManualEntrySupported().
  • Authorization code entry disabled if !CardConfig.isExtTerminalSupported().
  • Development mode:
  • In development mode, pre-fills the field with a sample swipe string.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User swipes card into the field (or types).
  2. Submit (or Enter key) reads cardString = new String(passwordField.getPassword()).
  3. Dialog sets canceled=false, disposes, and calls cardInputListener.cardInputted(this, PaymentType.CREDIT_CARD).
  4. Manual Entry path disposes and opens ManualCardEntryDialog.
  5. Authorization Code path disposes and opens AuthorizationCodeDialog.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text: • Security: Raw card swipe strings are highly sensitive; any logging/storage behavior must be verified in processors (not proven here).

docs.title: Feature: Authorization code entry (card-type selection + qwerty keypad)
Classification
docs.text:

  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Support external-terminal or voice authorization workflows where the operator must key an authorization code and specify card type.
  • Evidence: Dialog contains card brand toggles (visa/master/amex/discover) plus debit variants, and returns a PaymentType to CardInputListener.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog (modal)
  • UI entry points: From SwipeCardDialog.openAuthorizationEntryDialog().
  • Controls observed:
  • Card type selectors (credit + debit)
  • Authorization code text field
  • On-screen qwerty keypad
  • Submit / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text: • Defaults to Visa selected.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User selects card type via toggle buttons.
  2. User enters authorization code.
  3. On Submit:
  4. Dialog disposes and calls cardInputListener.cardInputted(this, getPaymentType()).
  5. getPaymentType() returns:
  6. CREDIT_VISA / CREDIT_MASTER_CARD / CREDIT_AMEX / CREDIT_DISCOVERY
  7. DEBIT_MASTER_CARD / DEBIT_VISA

docs.title: Feature: Authorization capture batch dialog (background thread)
Classification
docs.text:
• Parity classification: PARITY REQUIRED
  • MagiDesk status: UNCERTAIN (not assessed yet)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Provide an operator-visible batch capture process for previously authorized transactions, with status logging and a safe “finish” only once work completes.
  • Evidence: AuthorizationDialog starts a background thread on show, iterates transactions, captures auth amounts via gateway processor, and appends per-transaction status to a text area.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog
  • UI entry points: Not proven here; likely called from “transactions/authorizations” workflows.

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• Non-closeable: DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE.
  • Finish button hidden until done.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. When set visible true, starts a new thread running run().
  2. For each transaction:
  3. Reads transaction.getCardReader() → CardReader.fromString(...).
  4. If CardReader.EXTERNAL_TERMINAL:
    • Marks transaction.captured=true and saves.
    • Writes success line to status area.
    • Continues without calling gateway.
  5. Else:
    • Uses CardConfig.getPaymentGateway().getProcessor() and calls captureAuthAmount(transaction).
    • Marks captured true, saves, appends success.
    • Sleeps 6 seconds between transactions when there is a next transaction.
  6. On exception: appends failure line with exception message.
  7. On completion: label changes to completion message and Finish button becomes visible.

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: Marks transactions captured and persists via PosTransactionDAO.saveOrUpdate.
  • Financial risk: Incorrect capture logic can leave authorizations uncaptured or double-captured.

  • DAO: PosTransactionDAO.saveOrUpdate
  • Gateway: CardConfig.getPaymentGateway().getProcessor().captureAuthAmount(...)

docs.text:

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Remove items from tickets before sending to kitchen or settling. Mistakes happen - wrong item, customer changes mind.
  • Evidence: DeleteTicketItemAction.java - removes selected item from ticket; validates state; logs removal.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action (button/key)
  • UI entry points: TicketView → Delete/Remove button; context menu
  • Exit paths: Immediate action (confirmation may be required)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Depends on item state:
  • Unsent items: Order entry permission
  • Sent items: Void permission (manager may be required)
  • State checks: Item must be selected; ticket open
  • Manager override: Required for sent items

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User selects item in ticket view
  2. User clicks Delete/Remove
  3. System checks item state:
  4. Unsent: Direct removal
  5. Sent to kitchen: Requires void permission, logs void
  6. Confirmation prompt (for sent items)
  7. Item removed from ticket
  8. Ticket totals recalculated
  9. If voided: Kitchen notified (void ticket printed)

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• No item selected: Error/disabled button
  • Last item on ticket: May allow or switch to void ticket
  • Item partially paid: Complex - may prevent or require adjustment
  • Modifier-only deletion: May require parent item deletion

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: TicketItem removed; Ticket totals updated
  • Audit events: Deletion/void logged with reason
  • Financial risk: Unauthorized voids; inventory discrepancy

docs.title: Code traceability (REQUIRED)

  • Entry action(s): DeleteTicketItemAction → actions/DeleteTicketItemAction.java
  • Workflow/service enforcement: Ticket.removeTicketItem()
  • Messages/labels: Confirmation prompts

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User adds item (e.g., burger)
  2. AddOnView prompt appears:
  3. "Would you like to add..."
  4. Button grid of add-on items
  5. Prices shown
  6. User can:
  7. Select add-ons (adds to order)
  8. Skip (no thanks)
  9. Selected add-ons added as separate items or linked
  10. Return to order entry

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• No add-ons configured: View not shown
  • Add-on out of stock: Hidden or disabled
  • Multiple add-on rounds: May chain

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact

  • Audit events: Part of order
  • Financial risk: Revenue opportunity; must be accurate

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Accept cash as payment. Most common payment method. Must handle exact, over-tender with change.
  • Evidence: PaymentView.java - Cash button; tender amount entry; change calculation.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Button + keypad
  • UI entry points: PaymentView/SettleDialog → Cash button
  • Exit paths: Payment accepted; ticket settled

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Cash payment permission
  • State checks: Drawer assigned; ticket has balance due
  • Manager override: Not typically required

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User in PaymentView with ticket
  2. Due amount displayed
  3. User clicks Cash (or enters amount and clicks Cash)
  4. Tender amount validation:
  5. Must be >= 0
  6. If < due: Partial payment applied
  7. If >= due: Ticket can be settled
  8. Change calculated (tender - due)
  9. Payment applied:
  10. CashPayment transaction created
  11. Terminal balance updated
  12. Ticket balance reduced
  13. If fully paid: Ticket closed
  14. Change displayed for giving back

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Exact amount: No change
  • Over-tender: Calculate change
  • Under-tender: Partial payment or reject
  • Multi-currency: Opens CurrencyTenderDialog

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates:
  • PosTransaction (cash)
  • Terminal.currentBalance increased
  • Ticket.paidAmount increased
  • Audit events: Cash payment logged
  • Financial risk: Incorrect change; drawer discrepancy

docs.text:
• Operational need: Accept credit/debit card payments. Requires card reader integration or manual entry.
  • Evidence: PaymentView.java - Card buttons (Visa, MC, etc.); swipe dialog; processor integration.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:

  • UI entry points: PaymentView → Card button
  • Exit paths: Payment authorized / Declined / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:

  • State checks: Card processor configured; ticket has balance
  • Manager override: Not required

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User in PaymentView
  2. Clicks Card button (or specific card type)
  3. SwipeCardDialog opens:
  4. Wait for card swipe
  5. OR Manual entry option
  6. OR External terminal entry
  7. Card data captured
  8. Authorization request sent to processor
  9. Wait for response (PaymentProcessWaitDialog)
  10. If approved:
  11. CardPayment transaction created
  12. Auth code stored
  13. Ticket balance reduced
  14. If declined: Show error, retry options

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Declined: Show reason, offer retry or alternate
  • Timeout: Show error, retry
  • Partial approval: May approve less than requested
  • Pre-authorization: Store for later capture

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: In table service, parties may want to pay together (consolidated) or one person pays for multiple tickets. Groups/parties need combined settlement.
  • Evidence: GroupSettleTicketDialog.java + GroupPaymentView.java + GroupSettleTicketAction.java - select multiple tickets, view combined total, process single payment.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Dialog
  • UI entry points: Switchboard → Group Settle button (permission-gated)
  • Exit paths: Settle (processes payment) / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Group settle permission
  • State checks: Multiple open tickets available; tickets not already paid
  • Manager override: May be required for cross-server tickets

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User clicks Group Settle button
  2. GroupSettleTicketSelectionWindow opens
  3. User selects multiple tickets to consolidate:
  4. Shows open tickets with totals
  5. Checkboxes for selection
  6. Running combined total
  7. On confirm selection:
  8. GroupSettleTicketDialog opens
  9. Shows combined ticket details
  10. GroupPaymentView for payment
  11. Payment processed against combined total
  12. All selected tickets marked as paid

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Single ticket: Falls back to regular settle
  • Tickets from different servers: May require permission
  • Partial payment of group: Complex - split handling
  • Some tickets already partial: Combined with remaining balance

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: Multiple Ticket.paid states; shared Payment transaction
  • Audit events: Group settlement logged
  • Financial risk: Tip allocation across servers; payment split errors

  • Entry action(s): GroupSettleTicketAction → actions/GroupSettleTicketAction.java
  • Workflow/service enforcement: TicketService for bulk operations
  • Messages/labels: Selection labels, totals

1. User opens SplitTicketDialog
  2. Selects "Split Evenly" mode
  3. Enters number of ways (N)
  4. System calculates:
  5. Total / N = amount per ticket
  6. Handles rounding (last ticket gets remainder)
  7. Separate tickets created
  8. Original closed

docs.text:

  • Evidence: SwipeCardDialog.java - captures card swipe; branches to manual entry or auth code entry; handles CardConfig settings for external terminals.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User selects card payment
  2. SwipeCardDialog opens
  3. Depending on CardConfig:
  4. Integrated reader: Wait for swipe/insert
  5. External terminal: Option for auth code entry
  6. Manual entry: Option to type card number
  7. For swipe:
  8. Raw track data captured
  9. Card number extracted
  10. Passed to card processor
  11. For manual entry:
  12. Opens ManualCardEntryDialog
  13. Card number, expiry, CVV entered
  14. For external terminal:
  15. Opens AuthorizationCodeDialog
  16. Auth code entered manually
  17. Card data passed to payment processor

  • Card declined: Error from processor
  • Timeout: Cancel or retry
  • Unsupported card type: Error message

docs.text:
• Operational need: Some businesses accept paper checks as payment. Need to record check number, validate, and track for deposit.
  • Evidence: CheckPaymentAction.java - accepts check as payment; records check number; matches amount.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action + dialog
  • UI entry points: PaymentView → Check button
  • Exit paths: Accept check / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Check payment permission
  • State checks: Ticket with due amount; check acceptance enabled
  • Manager override: May be required above threshold

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User in PaymentView clicks Check
  2. Check payment dialog:
  3. Check number entry
  4. Amount (defaults to due)
  5. Bank name (optional)
  6. User enters check details
  7. On accept:
  8. CheckPayment transaction created
  9. Check number recorded
  10. Ticket balance updated
  11. Check physically received
  12. Appears in check deposit report

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• No check number: Validation error
  • Amount mismatch: Allows over-tender with cash back
  • Check declined later: Reconciliation issue

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact

  • Audit events: Check payment logged
  • Financial risk: Bad checks; deposit reconciliation

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Restaurants sell and accept gift certificates as payment. Staff need to enter gift cert number and face value to apply as payment toward ticket.
  • Evidence: GiftCertDialog.java - prompts for certificate number (up to 64 chars) and face value (defaults to $50). Validates non-empty number and positive face value.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Modal dialog
  • UI entry points: PaymentView → Gift Certificate button (when configured)
  • Exit paths: OK (applies gift cert) / Cancel (returns to payment view)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Standard payment permissions
  • State checks: Ticket must exist with due amount > 0
  • Manager override: Not required for standard gift cert redemption

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User clicks Gift Certificate button in PaymentView
  2. GiftCertDialog opens with text fields for cert number and face value
  3. User enters gift certificate number (required, max 64 chars)
  4. User enters face value (defaults to $50, must be > 0)
  5. QWERTY keypad available for entry
  6. On OK: Validates inputs, returns values to payment processor
  7. If face value > due amount, difference can be refunded as cash back
  8. Transaction created with gift cert details

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Empty cert number: Error message "Please enter gift certificate number"
  • Zero/negative face value: Error message "Please enter face value"
  • Face value exceeds due amount: Allowed, generates cash back transaction
  • Cert already redeemed: Not validated in dialog (business logic in processor)

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: PosTransaction with giftCertNumber, giftCertFaceValue, giftCertPaidAmount, giftCertCashBackAmount
  • Audit events: Payment transaction logged
  • Financial risk: Duplicate redemption if cert tracking not implemented; cash back fraud

  • Workflow/service enforcement: SettleTicketProcessor handles gift cert payment logic
  • Messages/labels: GiftCertDialog.0 through GiftCertDialog.15

docs.text:
• Gift certificate validity checking (appears to be external/store-side)
  • Cash back maximum limits (not visible in dialog code)

  • What differs / missing: Entire gift certificate payment flow missing

  • UI requirements: GiftCertDialog with cert number input, face value input, QWERTY keyboard
  • Constraints for implementers: Must track cash back separately; cannot exceed face value in payments

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Servers need to add tips/gratuity to tickets. This can happen at payment time or after (for bar tabs, credit cards with tip line).
  • Evidence: GratuityInputDialog.java - numeric keypad for gratuity amount entry. Called from PaymentView when adding tips.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Modal dialog
  • UI entry points: PaymentView → Add Gratuity button; also from settle flow for tip-later order types
  • Exit paths: OK (applies gratuity) / Cancel (no gratuity added)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Standard payment permissions; may require owner of ticket
  • State checks: Ticket must exist; order type must allow gratuity (checked via OrderType.isAllowToAddTipsLater())
  • Manager override: May be required for excessive tips (tipsExceedAmount handling in FloreantPOS)

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User initiates gratuity entry (from PaymentView or settle dialog)
  2. GratuityInputDialog opens with numeric keypad
  3. User enters gratuity amount using keypad
  4. Amount displayed in text field (right-aligned, bold, large font)
  5. On OK: Gratuity amount returned to caller
  6. Gratuity applied to ticket/transaction
  7. If order type allows tips later, receipt prints with tip line

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Zero gratuity: Allowed (user may cancel instead)
  • Negative amount: Prevented by DoubleTextField
  • Tips exceeding transaction amount: Tracked separately as tipsExceedAmount
  • Tips on void/refund: Must be handled separately (VoidTicketDialog has tips refund option)

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: Ticket.gratuity (Gratuity entity with amount, paid status, owner, terminal)
  • Audit events: Gratuity added to ticket logged
  • Financial risk: Tip skimming; tips not paid out to servers; tip pooling calculations

  • Workflow/service enforcement: Gratuity entity persisted; GratuityDAO for queries
  • Messages/labels: GratuityInputDialog.0 (title)

  • Tip pooling rules (business policy, not in code)

  • UI requirements: NumericKeypad dialog for gratuity entry; integration with payment flow
  • Constraints for implementers: Gratuity must be auditable; cannot modify after ticket closed

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Managers need to record cash payouts from the drawer for legitimate business expenses (deliveries, supplies, vendor payments). This must be tracked for drawer reconciliation.
  • Evidence: PayoutDialog.java - records payout with reason, recipient, amount, note. Creates PayOutTransaction with DEBIT type. Updates terminal balance. Logs to ActionHistory.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Modal dialog
  • UI entry points: ManagerDialog → Payout button; also via PayoutAction from switchboard (permission-gated)
  • Exit paths: OK/Finish (records payout) / Cancel (no change)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Requires payout permission (checked via UserPermission in PayoutAction)
  • State checks: Drawer must be assigned; sufficient cash balance assumed
  • Manager override: Action itself requires manager-level permission

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User with permission clicks Payout button
  2. PayoutDialog opens with PayOutView form
  3. User enters:
  4. Payout amount (required, numeric)
  5. Reason (selected from PayoutReason list)
  6. Recipient (selected from PayoutRecepient list)
  7. Note (optional text)
  8. On OK/Finish:
  9. Terminal balance reduced by payout amount
  10. PayOutTransaction created with:
    • paymentType = CASH
    • transactionType = DEBIT
    • reason, recipient, note, amount
    • user, terminal, timestamp
  11. Transaction saved via PayOutTransactionDAO
  12. ActionHistory logged with PAY_OUT action
  13. Dialog closes

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Zero/negative amount: Should be validated (not visible in code excerpt)
  • Insufficient drawer cash: Not explicitly validated (drawer can go negative)
  • No reason/recipient selected: May proceed with null values
  • Database error: Exception shown to user, transaction not saved

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates:
  • Terminal.currentBalance reduced
  • PayOutTransaction created
  • ActionHistory created
  • Audit events: ActionHistory.PAY_OUT with amount logged
  • Financial risk: Unauthorized payouts; no approval workflow; drawer shortage

  • Entry action(s): PayoutAction → actions/PayoutAction.java

  • Messages/labels: PayoutDialog.2 (amount label)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Open cash drawer without a sale transaction. Legitimate uses: making change, placing float. Must be tracked for loss prevention.
  • Evidence: NoSaleAction.java - opens drawer; logs "NO SALE" transaction; requires permission.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action (button)
  • UI entry points: ManagerDialog → No Sale; Switchboard (permission-gated)
  • Exit paths: Immediate action

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: No Sale permission (often manager-only)
  • State checks: Drawer must be assigned
  • Manager override: Action typically IS manager-level

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User with permission clicks No Sale
  2. System validates:
  3. User has NO_SALE permission
  4. Drawer is assigned to terminal
  5. Cash drawer triggered to open
  6. "No Sale" transaction logged:
  7. Timestamp
  8. User
  9. Terminal
  10. Reason (if prompted)
  11. No money changes hands (just drawer access)

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• No drawer assigned: Error message
  • Drawer mechanism failure: Hardware error
  • Frequent no-sales: Loss prevention alert

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: NoSale transaction record
  • Audit events: No Sale logged (appears on exception report)
  • Financial risk: Unauthorized drawer access; cash theft opportunity

  • Drawer kick interface
  • API/DTO requirements: POST /cash-drawer/no-sale
  • UI requirements: No Sale button (manager)
  • Constraints for implementers: Must be audited; appears on exception report

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Remove excess cash from drawer during shift to safe/bank. Reduces theft risk and robbery impact. Must be tracked for accountability.
  • Evidence: DrawerBleedAction.java + CashDropDialog.java - record cash removal amount; update drawer balance.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action + Dialog
  • UI entry points: ManagerDialog → Cash Drop/Drawer Bleed
  • Exit paths: Complete / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections

  • State checks: Drawer must be assigned with cash
  • Manager override: Action itself is manager-level

docs.text:
1. Manager clicks Cash Drop
  2. CashDropDialog opens:
  3. Current drawer balance shown
  4. Amount to drop field
  5. Note/reason field (optional)
  6. Manager enters drop amount
  7. On confirm:
  8. CashDropTransaction created (DEBIT type)
  9. Terminal balance reduced
  10. Transaction logged
  11. Physical cash moved to safe
  12. Drawer balance updated

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Drop exceeds balance: May allow or warn
  • Multi-currency: Per-currency amounts
  • Zero drop: Prevented

  • CashDropTransaction
  • Terminal.currentBalance

  • Financial risk: Essential for accountability; mismatched drops

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Before processing cash transactions, a cash drawer must be assigned to the terminal with a starting balance. This enables cash accountability at end of shift.
  • Evidence: DrawerAssignmentAction.java + MultiCurrencyAssignDrawerDialog.java - assigns drawer to user/terminal; sets initial balance; supports multi-currency.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action + dialog
  • UI entry points: Login screen (if drawer required); Manager functions; prompted when cash payment attempted
  • Exit paths: Assign / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:

  • State checks: No existing open drawer for terminal; terminal configured
  • Manager override: Not typically required

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. System detects drawer not assigned (or user initiates)
  2. DrawerAssignmentAction opens
  3. Dialog prompts for:
  4. Initial balance (counted cash in drawer)
  5. User assignment (who is responsible)
  6. Multi-currency amounts (if enabled)
  7. On confirm:
  8. CashDrawer record created
  9. Terminal.assignedDrawer set
  10. Terminal.currentBalance set
  11. User now able to process cash
  12. Drawer can be pulled at shift end

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Drawer already assigned: Show existing, offer to close first
  • Zero balance: Allowed (some start empty)
  • Multi-currency mismatch: Validate all configured currencies

docs.text:

  • Audit events: Drawer assignment logged
  • Financial risk: Incorrect starting balance affects reconciliation; accountability gap

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Customers may need refunds for paid orders (wrong order, quality issues, returns). Managers need to process refunds with proper controls and audit trail.
  • Evidence: RefundAction.java - validates ticket is paid and not already refunded; prompts for refund amount; cannot exceed paid amount; handles gratuity refund; logs action.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action + confirmation dialogs
  • UI entry points: Switchboard → Refund button (permission-gated); Manager functions
  • Exit paths: Complete refund / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Requires REFUND permission (UserPermission.REFUND)
  • State checks:
  • Ticket must be selected OR entered by ID
  • Ticket must be PAID (isPaid() == true)
  • Ticket must NOT be already refunded (isRefunded() == false)
  • Manager override: Permission-based; action itself requires elevated access

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User clicks Refund button with ticket selected (or enters ticket ID if none selected)
  2. System validates:
  3. Ticket is paid → Error: "Ticket is not paid"
  4. Ticket not refunded → Error: "Ticket already refunded"
  5. Full ticket loaded from DB (loadFullTicket)
  6. Dialog shows:
  7. Ticket ID
  8. Paid amount
  9. Gratuity amount (if exists)
  10. User enters refund amount (defaults to paid amount)
  11. Validation: refund cannot exceed paid amount
  12. On confirm:
  13. PosTransactionService.refundTicket(ticket, refundAmount)
  14. Success message shown
  15. Ticket list updated

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Ticket not found: Error dialog
  • Not paid: Error "Ticket is not paid. Only paid ticket can be refunded"
  • Already refunded: Error "This ticket has already been refunded"
  • Amount exceeds paid: Error "Refund amount cannot be more than paid amount"
  • Partial refund: Allowed (enter less than paid amount)
  • Gratuity: Shown separately; may need separate refund handling

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates:
  • Ticket.refunded = true
  • PosTransaction created (refund type)
  • Terminal balance affected
  • Audit events: ActionHistory logged; transaction recorded
  • Financial risk: Unauthorized refunds; refund fraud; incorrect amounts

docs.text:

  • Entry action(s): Button in SwitchboardView, tied to ITicketList
  • Workflow/service enforcement:
  • PosTransactionService.refundTicket()
  • TicketService.getTicket()
  • NumberSelectionDialog2 for amount input
  • Messages/labels: RefundAction.0 through RefundAction.12

docs.title: Uncertainties (STOP; do not guess)
docs.text:
• Gratuity refund workflow (separate from ticket refund?)
  • Card transaction refund vs cash refund handling

docs.text:

  • What differs / missing: Full RefundAction workflow; permission gating; amount selection dialog

docs.text:

  • RefundTicketCommand with ticketId, amount, reason

  • Create refund transaction

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: When servers go on break or off shift, their open tickets need to be transferred to another server. Tips and responsibility must transfer with the ticket.
  • Evidence: UserTransferDialog.java - shows list of active users; allows selection; transfers ticket ownership. Called from OpenTicketsListDialog.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Modal dialog
  • UI entry points: OpenTicketsListDialog → Transfer Server button; Manager functions
  • Exit paths: Select user (transfers) / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Requires transfer permission; manager may be required
  • State checks: Ticket must be open (not closed/paid)
  • Manager override: May be required for cross-section transfers

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. Manager/server selects ticket in open tickets list
  2. Clicks Transfer Server button
  3. UserTransferDialog opens with list of active users
  4. User selects target server
  5. On confirm:
  6. Ticket.owner updated to new user
  7. Gratuity.owner updated if exists
  8. Ticket saved
  9. List refreshed

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Same user selected: No-op or error
  • User not clocked in: May not appear in list
  • User has no table section privilege: May be prevented
  • Ticket partially paid: Transfer still allowed

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: Ticket.owner; Gratuity.owner
  • Audit events: Transfer logged in ActionHistory
  • Financial risk: Tips attributed to wrong server; accountability issues

  • Entry action(s): Button in OpenTicketsListDialog
  • Workflow/service enforcement: TicketDAO.saveTicket()
  • Messages/labels: User list labels

docs.title: Uncertainties (STOP; do not guess)
docs.text:

  • Tip pool implications

docs.title: MagiDesk parity notes
docs.text:

  • Update owner on ticket and related entities
  • API/DTO requirements: POST /tickets/{id}/transfer
  • UI requirements: UserTransferDialog with user list
  • Constraints for implementers: Must audit transfer; tips must follow ticket

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Combine two tickets into one - parties joining together, server consolidation, order correction.
  • Evidence: MergeTicketAction.java - combines items from source ticket into target ticket.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Action + dialog
  • UI entry points: TicketView → Merge button; OpenTicketsListDialog
  • Exit paths: Merge complete / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User has ticket A open
  2. Clicks Merge
  3. Dialog shows other open tickets (B)
  4. User selects ticket B to merge into A
  5. On confirm:
  6. All items from B moved to A
  7. Discounts/notes combined
  8. Ticket B voided/deleted
  9. Ticket A recalculated
  10. Single ticket with all items

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Different order types: Warning/prevent
  • Different customers: Choose which to keep
  • Partial payment on one: Prevents merge or handles complex
  • Same table: Allowed

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:

  • Ticket A updated with items
  • Ticket B deleted/voided
  • Audit events: Merge logged
  • Financial risk: Low if not paid; complex if partial

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Fine dining tracks items by seat number for proper delivery. Split by seat allows separate checks per diner.
  • Evidence: SeatSelectionDialog.java - select seat number when adding items; enables seat-based ordering and split.

  2. SeatSelectionDialog opens (or seat selector in UI)
  3. Shows seat numbers (1 to table capacity)
  4. User selects seat number
  5. Item tagged with seat number
  6. On split by seat:
  7. SplitTicketDialog uses seat numbers
  8. Creates separate tickets per seat
  9. Kitchen ticket shows seat numbers

  2. View shows:
  3. Receipt printer selection
  4. Kitchen printer(s) selection
  5. Report printer selection
  6. Printer groups (for menu item routing)
  7. Receipt format options (full, compact)
  8. Paper size settings
  9. Cash drawer connection
  10. AddPrinterDialog for new printers
  11. AddPrinterGroupDialog for grouping
  12. Test print option
  13. Save persists printer configuration

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Printer offline: Error on test print; warning on save
  • No printers found: List empty
  • Printer group empty: May cause routing failures

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: Printer configuration; PrinterGroup entities
  • Audit events: Config changes logged
  • Financial risk: Low - operational; missed kitchen prints affect service

docs.title: Code traceability (REQUIRED)
docs.text:
• Primary UI class(es):
  • PrintConfigurationView → config/ui/PrintConfigurationView.java
  • AddPrinterDialog → config/ui/AddPrinterDialog.java
  • PrinterGroupView → config/ui/PrinterGroupView.java
  • Entry action(s): Part of ConfigurationDialog
  • Workflow/service enforcement: PrintConfig.java for settings
  • Messages/labels: Printer names, group names

docs.title: Uncertainties (STOP; do not guess)
docs.text:

  • Printer driver compatibility (platform specific)
  • Virtual printer support

  • What differs / missing: Entire print configuration system

  • PrinterGroup with associated menu items
  • API/DTO requirements: Printer config stored locally or in DB
  • UI requirements: Full print configuration view
  • Constraints for implementers: Windows printing APIs; consider ESC/POS for receipt printers

docs.text:

  • Evidence: TaxConfigurationView.java - tax configuration as part of restaurant settings.

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)

  2. View shows global tax settings:
  3. Default tax rate
  4. Tax included in price (toggle)
  5. Rounding rules
  6. Tax on gratuities
  7. Tax on discounts

  11. Save applies settings

  • MagiDesk status: PARTIAL (Admin pages exist but not unified BO window)

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Managers need access to configuration, reports, user management, menu management outside of the POS workflow. Separate management interface.
  • Evidence: BackOfficeWindow.java - main window with JMenuBar containing menus for Reports, Menu Management, Configuration, Users, etc. Uses tabbed pane for content.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Standalone window with menus and tabs
  • UI entry points: LoginView → Back Office button; ShowBackofficeAction
  • Exit paths: Close window (saves size/location)

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Back office access permission
  • State checks: User must be logged in with appropriate role
  • Manager override: Not required (permission-based)

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User clicks Back Office button from login or switchboard
  2. BackOfficeWindow opens (size/position from saved config)
  3. Menu bar provides access to:
  4. File: Data import/export, language selection
  5. Edit: (editing options)
  6. Explorers: Menu categories, groups, items, modifiers
  7. Reports: All report types
  8. Configuration: Restaurant, terminal, card, print settings
  9. Floor Plan: Table layout management (plugin)
  10. Each menu action opens content in tabbed pane
  11. Multiple tabs can be open simultaneously
  12. On close: Window size/position saved

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• No permission for menu item: Item hidden or disabled
  • Multiple BO windows: Singleton pattern (getInstance)
  • Unsaved changes in tab: Prompt on close

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: All configuration, menu, user data through explorers
  • Audit events: Changes logged in ActionHistory
  • Financial risk: Misconfiguration affects pricing, taxes, operations

  • Messages/labels: Menu item labels; tab titles

docs.text:

  2. Explorer shows table of all menu items with columns:

  4. Category
  5. Group
  6. Price
  7. Active status
  8. User can:
  9. Search/filter items
  10. Click New to add item
  11. Double-click to edit
  12. Delete selected item
  13. Edit opens MenuItemForm with:
  14. Basic info (name, description, barcode)
  15. Pricing (base price, order type prices)
  16. Category/group assignment
  17. Modifier groups
  18. Printer group assignment
  19. Stock tracking settings
  20. Image upload
  21. Save persists changes

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Define work shifts (morning, evening, split) with start/end times. Shifts affect labor reporting, employee scheduling, cash accountability.
  • Evidence: ShiftExplorer.java - CRUD for shift definitions; name, start time, end time; used in attendance and reporting.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Explorer panel (in Back Office)
  • UI entry points: BackOfficeWindow → Explorers → Shifts
  • Exit paths: Close tab

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Shift management permission
  • State checks: None
  • Manager override: Not required

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. Open Shift Explorer from Back Office
  2. View shows table of shifts:
  3. Shift name
  4. Start time
  5. End time
  6. Active status
  7. Actions:
  8. New: Create new shift
  9. Edit: Modify shift times
  10. Delete: Remove shift (if unused)
  11. Shift form includes:
  12. Name (e.g., "Morning", "Evening", "Split")
  13. Start time (hour:minute)
  14. End time (hour:minute)
  15. Shifts assigned to users and used in reports

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Overlapping shifts: Allowed (flexible scheduling)
  • Delete shift in use: Prevent or warn
  • Overnight shift: End time < start time = next day

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: Shift entity
  • Audit events: Shift changes logged
  • Financial risk: Low - affects labor reports

docs.title: Code traceability (REQUIRED)

  • Workflow/service enforcement: ShiftDAO
  • Messages/labels: Shift name, time labels

docs.title: Uncertainties (STOP; do not guess)
docs.text:

  • Automatic shift detection based on clock in time

  • ShiftService for CRUD
  • API/DTO requirements: GET/POST/PUT/DELETE /shifts
  • UI requirements: ShiftExplorer with table and form
  • Constraints for implementers: Time handling must consider overnight shifts

docs.title: Problem / Why this exists (grounded)
docs.text:
• Operational need: Staff need to apply coupons/discounts to tickets for promotions, loyalty, manager courtesy, etc. Discounts affect ticket totals and must be tracked.
  • Evidence: CouponAndDiscountDialog.java - lists available coupons; shows discount details (type, value); can edit value; validates minimum buy; applies to ticket.

docs.title: User-facing surfaces
docs.text:
• Surface type: Modal dialog
  • UI entry points: OrderView/TicketView → Discount button; PaymentView coupon button
  • Exit paths: OK (applies discount) / Cancel

docs.title: Preconditions & protections
docs.text:
• User/role/permission checks: Discount permission; some discounts require manager
  • State checks: Ticket must exist; minimum buy requirements checked
  • Manager override: Required for certain discount types or amounts

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User clicks Discount/Coupon button
  2. CouponAndDiscountDialog opens
  3. Dialog shows:
  4. Available coupons list (from DiscountDAO)
  5. Coupon name, number, type, value fields
  6. Up/Down navigation for list
  7. Edit Value button
  8. User selects coupon from list
  9. Details populate (type, value, minimum)
  10. User can edit value (for percentage/amount discounts)
  11. On OK:
  12. Validates minimum buy if required
  13. Creates TicketDiscount snapshot
  14. Applies to ticket
  15. Recalculates totals

docs.title: Edge cases & failure paths
docs.text:
• Minimum buy not met: Error message, discount not applied
  • Invalid coupon value: Validation error
  • Multiple discounts: Only max discount applies (policy in FloreantPOS)
  • Coupon expired: Not shown in list or error on apply

docs.title: Data / audit / financial impact
docs.text:
• Writes/updates: TicketDiscount entity; Ticket totals recalculated
  • Audit events: Discount application logged
  • Financial risk: Unauthorized discounts; incorrect amounts; revenue loss

docs.title: Code traceability (REQUIRED)
docs.text:
• Primary UI class(es): CouponAndDiscountDialog → ui/dialog/CouponAndDiscountDialog.java
  • Entry action(s): Button in OrderView, PaymentView
  • Workflow/service enforcement: DiscountDAO; Ticket.calculatePrice()
  • Messages/labels: Labels, coupon list renderer

docs.title: Uncertainties (STOP; do not guess)
docs.text:
• Coupon code entry (vs. pre-loaded list)
  • Stackable discount support

docs.title: MagiDesk parity notes
docs.text:
• What exists today: TicketDiscount entity; discount application in Ticket
  • What differs / missing: Coupon selection dialog; minimum buy validation

docs.title: Porting strategy (PLAN ONLY)
docs.text:
• Backend requirements:
  • Discount entity with type, value, minimumBuy
  • ApplyDiscountCommand with validation
  • TicketDiscount snapshot creation
  • API/DTO requirements: GET /discounts; POST /tickets/{id}/discounts
  • UI requirements: DiscountSelectionDialog with list, details, validation
  • Constraints for implementers: Discount must be immutable snapshot; recalculate totals on apply

docs.text:
• Operational need: Confirm destructive/important actions before execution. Prevent accidents.
  • Evidence: POSMessageDialog.java + ConfirmDeleteDialog.java - confirmation pattern used throughout.

docs.text:

  • UI entry points: Various destructive actions (void, delete, refund)
  • Exit paths: Confirm / Cancel

docs.text:

  • State checks: Inherited from parent action
  • Manager override: If parent action requires

docs.title: Step-by-step behavior (forensic)
docs.text:
1. User initiates sensitive action
  2. ConfirmDialog opens:
  3. Question/warning text
  4. Yes/No or Confirm/Cancel buttons
  5. Clear indication of consequence
  6. User decides:
  7. Confirm: Action proceeds
  8. Cancel: Return without action

docs.text:

  • Evidence: WaitDialog.java + PaymentProcessWaitDialog.java - blocking wait with progress indicator.

  8. On complete:

docs.title: Phase 1: Enhanced Table Map Explorer (F-0082 Enhancement)
1.1 Real-time Status Updates
docs.text:
Files to Modify: - ViewModels/TableMapViewModel.cs - Views/TableMapPage.xaml

Implementation Tasks: - [ ] Add real-time polling timer for table status updates - [ ] Implement efficient status change detection - [ ] Add visual feedback for status changes - [ ] Optimize performance to avoid unnecessary UI updates

Code Template: 

// Add to TableMapViewModel.cs
private Timer _refreshTimer;

private void StartStatusPolling()
{
    _refreshTimer = new Timer(async _ => await RefreshTableStatus(), 
                             null, TimeSpan.Zero, TimeSpan.FromSeconds(5));
}

private async Task RefreshTableStatus()
{
    var updatedTables = await _getAvailableTables.HandleAsync(new GetAvailableTablesQuery());
    // Update only changed tables for performance
    foreach (var table in updatedTables.Tables)
    {
        var existing = Tables.FirstOrDefault(t => t.Id == table.Id);
        if (existing != null && existing.Status != table.Status)
        {
            existing.Status = table.Status;
        }
    }
}
